definition: members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: Later Jin Dynasty was also once abolished Hanlin degree, their functions and to go in the book rounding.
sentences.chinese: 後晉還一度廢除翰林學士，其職並歸中書舍人。

sentences.english: The Han wood's bachelor's degree was a vice minister class, was a Qing further mutually.
sentences.chinese: 翰林學士就是副部長級了，進一步就是卿相。

sentences.english: HAN-Lin played a major political role in the late Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐代自進入中後期，翰林學士的政治角色日形重要。

definition: place where the emperor listened to lectures (traditional)
honorific title during Tang to Qing times, approx. "Glorious grand master"
expert in a specialized field such as medicine, divination or chess, available on call to the emperor (in the Tang and Song dynasties)
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
Runzhou district of Zhenjiang city 鎮江市|镇江市[Zhen4 jiang1 shi4], Jiangsu
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
